com.android.multiplay

Class MainActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • com.android.multiplay.MainActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DialogButtonClickListener

    public class MainActivity
extends Activity
implements DialogButtonClickListener
    Main Activity for MultiPlay application. When you first start the device scans for the presence of service that uses the application by calling TODO. In their absence, the relevant part of the software functionality will be disabled. Re-test the device can be called from the OptionsActivity. Activity implements DialogButtonClickListener which enables it to respond appropriately to closing the dialog box by tapping one of three buttons (see AlertDialogs). In the activity's background works ConnectionService which is responsible for the initial configuration of the application. Activity consist of menu elements which lead to other activities:
    • MultiplayExplorerActivity
    • SystemControllerActivity
    • OptionsActivity
    • HelpActivity
    See Also:
    AlertDialogs, DialogButtonClickListener, ConnectionService

      • onDialogPositiveClick

        public void onDialogPositiveClick(DialogFragment dialog)
        Method triggered by tapping on a DialogInterface#BUTTON_POSITIVE. Method handles AlertDialogs.positiveButton tapping and executes appropriate code based on received dialog tag (see AlertDialogs.showDialog(Activity, String, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer)). It handles dialogs with tags:
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_BLUETOOTH_CONNECTED - if Context#BLUETOOTH_SERVICE is enabled and it is set as a service with the highest priority (see ConnectionsActivity.b_connections_activity_bluetooth_switcher) method redirects user to ConnectionsActivity. It also automatically trigger ConnectionsActivity.bluetooth_switcher_onClick(View) to search for bluetooth devices. Other options are handle by other methods: onDialogNeutralClick(DialogFragment) and onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment).
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_BLUETOOTH_ENABLED - if Context#BLUETOOTH_SERVICE is enabled by tapping ConnectionPanel.b_bluetooth_switch user can be redirected to ConnectionsActivity in the same way as in the above case. Other options are handle by other methods: onDialogNeutralClick(DialogFragment) and onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment).
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_WIFI_CONNECTED - if Context#WIFI_SERVICE and/or Context#WIFI_P2P_SERVICE is enabled and it is set as a service with the highest priority (see ConnectionsActivity.b_connections_activity_wireless_switcher) method redirects user to ConnectionsActivity. It also automatically trigger ConnectionsActivity.wireless_switcher_onClick(View) to search for available devices by using Context#WIFI_P2P_SERVICE or ConnectionsActivity.new_connection_onClick() otherwise. Other options are handle by other methods: onDialogNeutralClick(DialogFragment) and onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment).
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_WIFI_ENABLED - if Context#WIFI_SERVICE is enabled by tapping ConnectionPanel.b_wireless_network_switch user can be redirected to ConnectionsActivity in the same way as in the above case. Other options are handle by other methods: onDialogNeutralClick(DialogFragment) and onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment).
        Specified by:
        onDialogPositiveClick in interface DialogButtonClickListener
        See Also:
        DialogListCore, MainActivity.DialogList, AlertDialogs, DialogButtonClickListener

      • onDialogNeutralClick

        public void onDialogNeutralClick(DialogFragment dialog)
        Method triggered by tapping on a DialogInterface#BUTTON_NEUTRAL. Method handles AlertDialogs.neutralButton tapping and executes appropriate code based on received dialog tag (see AlertDialogs.showDialog(Activity, String, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer)). It handles dialogs with tags:
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_BLUETOOTH_CONNECTED - if Context#BLUETOOTH_SERVICE is enabled and it is set as a service with the highest priority (see ConnectionsActivity.b_connections_activity_bluetooth_switcher) and also there is default bluetooth connection stored in application memory method will check it and set as a default for entire application. Other options are handle by other methods: onDialogPositiveClick(DialogFragment) and onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment).
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_BLUETOOTH_ENABLED - if Context#BLUETOOTH_SERVICE is enabled by tapping ConnectionPanel.b_bluetooth_switch and also there is default bluetooth connection stored in application memory method will check it and set as a default for entire application. Other options are handle by other methods: onDialogPositiveClick(DialogFragment) and onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment).
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_WIFI_CONNECTED - if Context#WIFI_SERVICE and/or Context#WIFI_P2P_SERVICE is enabled and it is set as a service with the highest priority (see ConnectionsActivity.b_connections_activity_wireless_switcher) and also there is default wireless connection stored in application memory method will check it and set as a default for entire application. Other options are handle by other methods: onDialogNeutralClick(DialogFragment) and onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment).
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_WIFI_ENABLED - if Context#WIFI_SERVICE is enabled by tapping ConnectionPanel.b_wireless_network_switch and also there is default wireless connection stored in application memory method will check it and set as a default for entire application. Other options are handle by other methods: onDialogPositiveClick(DialogFragment) and onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment).
        Specified by:
        onDialogNeutralClick in interface DialogButtonClickListener
        See Also:
        DialogListCore, MainActivity.DialogList, AlertDialogs, DialogButtonClickListener

      • onDialogNegativeClick

        public void onDialogNegativeClick(DialogFragment dialog)
        Method triggered by tapping on a DialogInterface#BUTTON_NEGATIVE. Method handles AlertDialogs.negativeButton tapping and executes appropriate code based on received dialog tag (see AlertDialogs.showDialog(Activity, String, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer, Integer)). It handles dialogs with tags:
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_BLUETOOTH_CONNECTED,
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_BLUETOOTH_ENABLED,
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_WIFI_CONNECTED,
        • MainActivity.DialogList.TAG_WIFI_ENABLED.
        When above dialogs are called and users leaves that dialogs without any action or by tapping DialogListCore.ID_BUTTON_CANCEL this method are triggered and it returns no data.
        Specified by:
        onDialogNegativeClick in interface DialogButtonClickListener
        See Also:
        DialogListCore, MainActivity.DialogList, AlertDialogs, DialogButtonClickListener
